title: Self-Efficacy Instrument Design for Computer Science Teacher Competency Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of educational assessment and general awareness of trends in computer science education
context.additional_context: Application of an instructional design framework referencing actual Thai research cases

learning_goals: Learners can explain the four domains (CK, ID, CM, PD) of the self-efficacy instrument for assessing computer science teacher competencies.
Learners can systematically design validation procedures for assessment tools using structural equation modeling (SEM).
Learners can propose comparative evaluation methods to analyze differences in self-efficacy based on teacher career stages/school scales.

resources: Thailand CS Teacher Competency Assessment Case Study Report

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
